intro: Stichorkis gjellerupii, commonly known as the Gjellerup's cactus, is a unique member of the Cactaceae family native to the arid regions of Namibia. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and spiny, ribbed stems that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. The plant produces yellow flowers during the rainy season, adding a striking contrast to its green foliage. Its structure is adapted for survival in extreme desert conditions, with a thick cuticle and reduced leaves. Stichorkis gjellerupii is a rare and specialized species, showcasing the diversity of cacti in arid ecosystems.
